title: 10 krooni
text:
The 10 krooni banknote (10 EEK) is a <a href="Denomination%20%28currency%29">denomination</a> of the <a href="Estonian%20kroon">Estonian kroon</a>, the former currency of <a href="Estonia">Estonia</a>. <a href="Jakob%20Hurt">Jakob Hurt</a> (1839–1907), who was an Estonian <a href="folklorist">folklorist</a>, <a href="theologian">theologian</a>, <a href="linguist">linguist</a> and prominent social figure during the <a href="Estonian%20national%20awakening">Estonian national awakening</a> in the 19th–20th century, is featured with an engraved portrait on the obverse side of the banknote. The 10 krooni bill is sometimes called a "Hurt".
A view of the <a href="Tamme-Lauri%20oak%20tree">Tamme-Lauri oak tree</a> at Urvaste is featured on the reverse.
The EEK has been withdrawn and replaced by the <a href="euro">euro</a>, but the 10 krooni can be exchanged indefinitely at the currency museum of Eesti Pank for €0.64.
Security features.
Source:
